value1: pron, nt acc sg of ta
comment1: Ven Siha suggest that it is form of idaṃ

Siha: This is etad + disa (S. dṛśa), corresponding to S. etādṛśa, tādṛśa. An adjective *ādisa (S. *ādṛśa) is listed neither in PED, CPD nor Cone and is also unknown to MW, Apte and Böthlingk, so it seems this is a ghost word in DPD.
since in SNP 42 variant with metrically lengthened ā
value3: bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n'ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti.

comment1: add from variant reading BD says it is acc. as adv. of manner. SCPN
value2: sac'āyaṃ, byagghapajja, kulaputto appāyo samāno uḷāraṃ jīvikaṃ kappeti, tassa bhavanti vattāro, udumbarakhādikaṃ c'āyaṃ kulaputto bhoge khādatī'ti.

comment1: add poetic version from māgaṇḍiyasutta SNP 47
